title: speech.internet.archive.20191023
abstract:
Scanning is the New Spinning 
Prepared Remarks of Carl Malamud 
Internet Archive Anniversary Celebration 
October 23, 2019, San Francisco 
Good evening! 
We still do not know who burned the Library of Alexandria.  
Perhaps it was Julius Cesar—who was trysting with Cleopatra but feared 
an attack from her brother Ptolemy.  Cesar set ﬁre to the wharves to 
prevent enemy boats from landing—and that ﬁre spread to warehouses 
that kept books—and maybe it also burned the library.
